DACx0501.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 # -----------------------------------------------------------
2 # Library to control DACx0501 devices
3 #
4 # (C) 2021 Christopher Sanchez, Lille, France
5 # Released under XX License
6 # email c.sanchez@niryo.com
7 # ---
8 import time
9 
10 from smbus2 import SMBus
11 
12 __version__ = "1.1.1-auto.0"
13 
14 # Internal constants:
15 _ADC80501_DEFAULT_ADDRESS = 0x49
16 _channel_I2C = 1
17 _v_ref = 2.5
18 _resolution = 16
19 # offset
20 _NOOP = 0x00
21 _DEVID = 0x01
22 _SYNC = 0x02
23 _CONFIG = 0x03
24 _GAIN = 0x04
25 _TRIGGER = 0x05
26 _STATUS = 0x07
27 _DAC = 0x08
28 
29 """
30  DAC80501 is 16-bit digital to analog converter.
31  :param int bus: The channel number if it's different to 1.
32  :param int address: The address of the device if set differently
33  from the default( see address in p.28 of datasheet ).
34  :param float v_ref: External or internal voltage reference 2.5V, 3.3V or 5V
35  :param int resolution: Resolution bits DAC80501 -> 16bits, DAC60501 -> 12 bits
36 """
37 
38 
39 class DACx0501Exception(Exception):
40  pass
41 
42 
43 class DACx0501(object):
44 
45  def __init__(self, bus=_channel_I2C, address=_ADC80501_DEFAULT_ADDRESS, v_ref=_v_ref, resolution=_resolution):
46 
47  # I2C bus object
48  self._i2c = SMBus(bus)
49  # added to avoid communication problems
50  time.sleep(1)
51 
52  self.v_ref = v_ref
53  self.res = resolution
54 
55  # I2C slave address
56  self._address = address
57 
58  # reset configuration (SOFT-RESET)
59  self._send_data_(_TRIGGER, 0x00, 0x0A)
60 
61  # enable asynchronus mode (for enabling synchronus mode(LDAC trigger) send 0x00, 0x01) p.32
62  self._send_data_(_SYNC, 0x00, 0x00)
63 
64  # if vref different to 2.5V
65  if self.v_ref == 2.5:
66  # use internal Vref
67  self._send_data_(_CONFIG, 0x00, 0x00)
68  # set REF-DIV (Vref divided by 1 -> bit 8) to 0 and BUFF-gain (gain x2 -> bit 0) to 1.
69  self._send_data_(_GAIN, 0x00, 0x01)
70  self.vout_max = 5.0
71  else:
72  # use external Vref
73  self._send_data_(_CONFIG, 0x01, 0x00)
74  # set REF-DIV (Vref divided by 2 -> bit 8) to 1 and BUFF-gain (gain x2 -> bit 0) to 1.
75  self._send_data_(_GAIN, 0x01, 0x01)
76  self.vout_max = self.v_ref
77 
78  def _send_data_(self, addr, byte1, byte2):
79  """Send byte1 and byte2 to addr address"""
80  self._i2c.write_i2c_block_data(self._address, addr, [byte1, byte2])
81  time.sleep(0.1)
82 
83  def _read_data(self, addr):
84  """Read 2 bytes from address addr."""
85  data = self._i2c.read_i2c_block_data(self._address, addr, 2)
86  return data
87 
88  def set_voltage_(self, voltage):
89  """Set a value, then calculate DAC value to send to device"""
90  if not 0 <= voltage <= self.vout_max:
91  raise DACx0501Exception("Voltage must be between 0 and Vout_max = {}".format(self.vout_max))
92 
93  dac_value = int((voltage * ((1 << self.res) - 1) / self.vout_max))
94 
95  if self.res == 12:
96  byte1 = (dac_value >> 4)
97  byte2 = (dac_value & 0x00F)
98  elif self.res == 14:
99  byte1 = (dac_value >> 6)
100  byte2 = (dac_value & 0x03F)
101  elif self.res == 16:
102  byte1 = (dac_value >> 8)
103  byte2 = (dac_value & 0x00FF)
104  else:
105  raise DACx0501Exception(
106  "Invalid resolution. Actual resolution is {} and must be in [12, 14, 16]".format(self.res))
107 
108  self._send_data_(_DAC, byte1, byte2)
